title: Desktop messages can't be resent
body:
# Problem

As a desktop user I want to be able to resend messages by clicking on them. Right now it is just red text.

# Implementation

Similar to mobile, click and get asked to resend.

# Acceptance Criteria

Can obviously resend messages.

# Notes

N/A

# Future Steps

See if we can share more code with mobile to make the same thing possible on both platforms. When that isn't possible, consider exposing it in Desktop but marking it as a TODO by default, with a link to new issue (build with users).
@oskarth as far as i know `resend` feature is disabled on mobile . @janherich may clarify something more

@asemiankevich I just checked, and on mobile, it's not even possible to send messages while user is offline, so hard to tell. I will check in the code, but I'm not aware of and was not really involved in any discussion about disabling message re-sending, better to ask @dmitryn since he originally developed the feature.
@janherich oh jeez i am sorry i thought you designed everything in Status :D indeed @dmitryn could clarify a bit
Huh, why did we disable a useful feature?

> it's not even possible to send messages while user is offline, so hard to tell.

Actually, it is possible. The app does not detect you are offline immediately. So, if you sent a message before seeing "Offline" status, that message will be marked as "sent" but lost (https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6415)

> as far as i know resend feature is disabled on mobile

I didn't know it was disabled. @asemiankevich can you point to issue / PR where it has happened? 

As for desktop, resending might be done in similar way using mobile client code. Desktop just needs its own UI part.
@dmitryn @oskarth seems i am wrong. I thought it was disabled. sorry for confusion

@asemiankevich @oskarth  but there is no more "Not sent" status (AFAIK) and I couldn't see this feature for a while.
That's why https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6415 and https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6080 were reported (that's where resend options should be used IMO).

From offline mode it is not possible to send a message (button is disabled). For desktop - it is possible (send button is enabled).
I'm not sure where and how for now and if it is even possible to trigger message in "Not sent" status for mobile.

So probably we need just make it consistent between mobile and desktop and find out where "Not sent" status should be used for both platforms?

Looks like this GHI should be marked as bug. Resending messages should already work for both mobile and desktop. I suggest to add "bug" label to this issue and work on other issues "Not sent" status, etc. in a separate GHI.
@dmitryn could you take https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6415 and https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/6080 to fix resending messages on mobile?
@lukaszfryc i'll take a look at #6415 - will hide send button while "Connecting to peers" shown (i.e. no mailserver connection)
@oskarth @siphiuel wdyt about hiding "Send" button when app detects offline mode ("Offline", "Connecting to peers")?

Hiding or maybe grey disable? Like this is something you can normally do but not right now. I feel like this is a design decision?

@chadyj @denis-sharypin
@EugeOrtiz please, help)
@lukaszfryc can you constantly emulate situation when we can resend message on mobile? I cannot so request your help
[Designs specs for desktop](https://www.figma.com/file/MRYBI5axcTwL4Ft8xAYhFOfy/Desktop?node-id=611%3A8) **Please use Figma to see the rest of the design details.**

> @oskarth @siphiuel wdyt about hiding "Send" button when app detects offline mode ("Offline", "Connecting to peers")?

@churik Can the error happen _after_ I hit the send button? If so, disabling it is not a good solution.

@EugeOrtiz @churik I think it might happen that there is no connectivity already, but we don't know about it yet (because e.g. we periodically poll servers for accessibility, and connection might get dropped somewhere in between).

> @lukaszfryc can you constantly emulate situation when we can resend message on mobile? I cannot so request your help

Yes, I could simulate it pretty consistently on slow network connection.

If @lukaszfryc can reproduce it on mobile, issue is relevant for desktop as well.
 Will ask your help when  it is fixed. Thanks!

Sure! 

> On 3 Dec 2018, at 15:23, Tetiana Churikova <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> If @lukaszfryc <https://github.com/lukaszfryc> can reproduce it on mobile, issue is relevant for desktop as well.
> Will ask your help when it is fixed. Thanks!
> 
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
